channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: ‚ÄúTop Gun-style aerial dogfights, rare in modern warfare, are now raging above the country.‚Äù ‚ÄúUkraine now has roughly 55 operational fighter jets, a number that is dwindling from shoot-downs and mechanical failures, as Ukrainian pilots are ‚Äú‚Äòstressing them to max performance.‚Äô‚Äù https://t.co/fMtlx2Ltef

‚ÄúThe only real analysts who come here from Russia are dissidents. The rest are front people, just like in the Soviet Union, and they manufacture Western champions of the Putin regime, chumps and useful idiots.‚Äù https://t.co/lfokUuwkrO

@JohnWet75740342 @igorsushko @BasDanteNero @France24_en @LeopoldineIL You‚Äôre assuming they‚Äôre typed and digitized. (They could be photos or faxed copies of handwritten letters, or something even equally hard to get flagged by automated security software.)
@SimonsRatio @TrentTelenko Not even his military seems to have that kind of access these days, after all.
@NotACriminal2 @Rrrrolf @CJhuber12 @TrentTelenko I mean, they tried to hide it by covering the top with branches‚Ä¶
@BbqBricks @Rrrrolf @CJhuber12 @TrentTelenko Check local barns?
@YWNReporter As kids we were always warned to listen for the sound of a freight train.
@maxseddon ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre explaining, you‚Äôre losing.‚Äù

@TraverHart @krisnova Russia could try to block/redirect all, say, UDP port 53 traffic at the network border, but that wouldn‚Äôt help if Google had anycast 8.8.8.8 servers running inside Russia. They could redirect _all_ residential ISP port 53 traffic, regardless of destination. Is that the case?
@llucky10 @S44235689 @johnsweeneyroar Yeah, that‚Äôs a tough one. Perhaps intermediaries (NGOs or friends/family) can vet listings in those kind of cases (i.e. human trafficking concerns).
@ArcherMail @SamRamani2 The power of Motorola? (A networked radar picket line can do wonders against many threats by feeding targeting data back to jammers, target decoys, and AA launch systems.)
@TheSpicedLife @melania_jacket @igorsushko @kamilkazani Thanks! Bookmarked.

@TheSpicedLife @melania_jacket @igorsushko @kamilkazani Due to uneven destruction in the world wars, some parts of Europe are _very_ old (e.g. I once nonchalantly ate a picnic lunch on the grass of a Roman amphitheater off a random side street a in rural English village), while in others nearly everything is less than 75 years old.
@TheSpicedLife @melania_jacket @igorsushko @kamilkazani YMMV, but this is a list of 140 accounts I have bookmarked over the past month: https://t.co/Kar1GVeTmy
@IrenaeanTerror @mrsorokaa As long as they promise to speak only Russian and pledge their undying loyalty to the Tsar?

@TheSpicedLife @melania_jacket @igorsushko A FSB analyst has had a long-running correspondence with a well-known Russian anti-prison-torture activist who is currently living in France. At least seven of those letters have been forwarded to @igorsushko since the beginning of the war, and he has kindly translated them.

@PFemme2 @JuliaDavisNews @oneunderscore__ Russia has always had limited access to trade w/o friendly regimes in regions today known as Belarus and Ukraine. If they lose Ukraine, eventually they‚Äôll lose #Georgia, and then #Tatarstan, and by then no one will be buying gas anymore; #Moscovy will be left with the fur trade. https://t.co/i691bTGCN8
@StephenElsberry @PFemme2 @JuliaDavisNews @oneunderscore__ ‚Ä¶ or for Ukraine to shut off existing lines from Russia to Europe. https://t.co/1N3JxU0ql3
